intro: Anthurium gandogeri, commonly known as the Bogotá anthurium, is a striking tropical plant native to the Andes region of Colombia. It is characterized by its vibrant, heart-shaped leaves that can range in color from deep green to reddish hues. The plant produces striking spathes that are typically bright red or orange, with a contrasting yellow spathe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Anthurium gandogeri is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in indoor conditions with proper care.
